tweets.html:
Watch The Steve Harvey Show with the sound off. The rewards are many.

— Chris Regan (@ChrisRRegan) May 12, 2015

tweets.author_name: Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas
tweets.html:
1. Create more male heroes
2. Make more toys of male heroes.
3. Make the male toys cheaper & easier to find
4. "Kids don't want girl toys!"

— Amy celebrates Wrinkle in Time instead of XMas (@spooloflies) May 12, 2015

I'm a full season behind on MAD MEN, not sure when I'll get around to it, but you all really make it seem like I'm missing something.

— ZC (@videodromology) May 12, 2015

I don’t care how Mad Men ends as long as there’s a freeze frame and a burst of electric guitar right before the end credits.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) May 12, 2015

I know how Mad Men ends but I'm not telling any of you people.

— Mark Lisanti (@marklisanti) May 12, 2015

Paul Lee wants to make clear that much of ABC’s schedule belongs to neither my parents nor grandparents.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 12, 2015

"This is not your Sunday school bible show....David is the original rock star. It has all the intrigue and sex of the real bible."--Paul Lee

— TV MoJoe (@TVMoJoe) May 12, 2015

If you're keeping track, ABC has 2 shows ("Muppets" and "Of Kings and Prophets") that aren't your parents' or grandparents' versions.

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) May 12, 2015

So nuts to you, parents and grandparents.

— Rick Porter (@rickporter) May 12, 2015

Now ABC' Paul Lee describing OF KINGS AND PROPHETS as "not your parents' Bible story." Maybe it will have muppets!

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) May 12, 2015

“Oil” is totally not your great-uncle’s “Dallas.” Or that’s what I’m assuming.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 12, 2015

Multiple new ABC shows are being described as “Not your parents’ ____.” But… I like my parents? And I am a parent?

— Noel Murray (@NoelMu) May 12, 2015

Note to Paul Lee: My grandmother is dead. Thanx for reminding me.

— Masked Scheduler (@maskedscheduler) May 12, 2015

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Whenever Paul Lee says “The Millennials” (and it’s a lot), I assume it’s a band or a new ABC show.

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) May 12, 2015

Paul Lee of ABC legitimately sounds like one of the executives who willed Poochie into existence. "These Muppets need to get biz-zay!"

— Josh Spiegel (@mousterpiece) May 12, 2015

Paul Lee on the Eddie Huang/#FreshOffTheBoat fiasco: "We love Eddie." (He doesn't love you!) #ABC #Upfronts2015

— Kate Aurthur (@KateAurthur) May 12, 2015

Describing Eddie Huang as "a firecracker" is some heroic demurring by Paul Lee.

— Oriana Schwindt (@Schwindter) May 12, 2015

ON THE SEASON FINALE OF “AMERICA’S FUNNIEST HOME VIDEOS”>Huge cliffhanger on whether anyone gets hit in the balls.

— Brian Lowry (@blowryontv) May 12, 2015

The original Muppet Show is smarter than almost everything on TV right now, so it only makes sense the new one is running away from it.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) May 12, 2015

ABC saying it is “number one in entertainment programming” is 1.) technically accurate and 2.) a nice way of saying “we don’t have sports."

— Todd VanDerWerff (@tvoti) May 12, 2015

Everyone is No. 1! Network TV, once again a lot like my 5-year-old's T-ball team. Everyone gets a trophy!

— Michael Schneider (@franklinavenue) May 12, 2015

Stan from #MadMen plays a dad w/teens in new ABC sitcom "The Real O'Neals," bc single people on cable are middle-aged parents on broadcast.

— Meredith Blake (@MeredithBlake) May 12, 2015

Bill Gates needs to establish a foundation to pay actors formerly on TV series I loved never to appear in sketchy sitcom pilots.

— James Poniewozik (@poniewozik) May 12, 2015

Ed Westwick plays a serial killer in “Wicked City.” But he’s still probably less awful than Chuck Bass.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 12, 2015

"Wynn Duffy Reacts to Muppets" https://t.co/jlzGNR0H2W

— Alan Sepinwall (@sepinwall) May 12, 2015

If 15 sites don't include that new female pig in their lists of "fresh faces of Fall" type posts, you will have failed #TheMuppets

— Kel "Jingle Jangle Bells" K. (@TVKel) May 12, 2015

Upfronts 2015:

ABC - Diversity, family comedies, soaps!
FOX - Diversity, action dramas, young people!
NBC - ...well, it worked in 95.

— Nti Aning (@NtiAning) May 12, 2015

Two ABC hashtags, #TGIF and #OFEONOTW, or Oh Fuck Every Other Night Of the Week

— Anthony Crupi (@crupicrupicrupi) May 12, 2015

I don't understand how the protagonist of Heartbreaker is both a surgeon *and* a woman. Is it set in a parallel universe? Are there wizards?

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) May 12, 2015

@SamuelAAdams Even weirder: she’s super dedicated, but doesn’t always play by the rules. How does that even _work_.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) May 12, 2015

Did y'all see that VIDEO? GILLIAN KISSED DAVID.

Linda = DEAD.

You can bury me over there with all my XF fic and dvds.

— Linda H (@bookdal) May 13, 2015

.@theXFilesfox fans, this one's for you http://t.co/hga4MMENkO pic.twitter.com/FlqKgIwM79

— People (@people) May 13, 2015

This is not your second cousin twice removed's #XFiles.

— Ryan McGee (@TVMcGee) May 12, 2015

So Gillian Anderson was just within 30 feet of me playing a tamborine while DD sang "Thank You For Letting Me Be Myself", 2015 is so weird.

— Nicole Anell 🤖 (@nicoleanell) May 13, 2015

All other tv shows can go home now. Thank you for playing. pic.twitter.com/xRoIwZfCiO

— Linda H (@bookdal) May 13, 2015

Ninety percent chance either Russell Brand or Kanye West is looking in a mirror right now.

— Tim Siedell (@badbanana) May 13, 2015

tweets.author_name: Michael William Terwilliger Ticonderoga Feld Sphar
tweets.html:
I've never seen True Detective but based on every HBO promo I assume it is a documentary about frowning.

— Michael William Terwilliger Ticonderoga Feld Sphar (@mikesphar) May 13, 2015

Nic Pizzolatto stared at Beau Willimon like a starved wolf eyeing a lamb. "I've got a take for you," he whispered. "A long. Hot. Take."

— meaning machine (@EricThurm) May 12, 2015

I still want to read Paul Kinsey's STAR TREK spec script.

— MZS (@mattzollerseitz) May 13, 2015

Ready for lots of love and a little heartbreak, read this. @cristela9 call my office, let's meet. https://t.co/WSNKMsnI34

— Norman Lear (@TheNormanLear) May 13, 2015

I'll call and set something up! Want to meet the man that taught me to love the multi-cam. You made art. Thank you. https://t.co/IQzaGJH25E

— Cristela Alonzo (@cristela9) May 13, 2015

Kalinda Sharma is the best foil for ambitious, well-dressed ladies who love wine. So can we get a Good Wife/Scandal crossover now or what?

— Maris Kreizman (@mariskreizman) May 13, 2015

It'd be awesome if the past two years of "Good Wife" camera trickery were a setup for the revelation that Kalinda is Alicia's Tyler Durden.

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) May 13, 2015

"Alicia, the firm hasn't had an investigator since 2013. And why are your hands covered in blood?"

— Tim Carvell (@timcarvell) May 13, 2015

Finally watching Sunday’s “Good Wife” and getting to That Scene. It’s GLORIOUS. They literally DON’T MAKE EYE CONTACT FOR A SECOND.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 13, 2015

The “Good Wife” creators, who wrote and directed the episode, could not get their two former stars to look at each other at the same time.

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 13, 2015

@HitFixDaniel That's the best argument for it not being green screen. Professional actors know how to fake an eyeline.

— Sam Adams (@SamuelAAdams) May 13, 2015

To *me* there seems to be no purpose to faking it. I imagine Margulies saying, “You have 10 seconds of my time. Shoot fast."

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 13, 2015

This is the worst-directed scene in TV history. This is Tommy Wiseau’s “The Good Wife.” This is “The Human Aliciapede”

— Daniel Fienberg (@TheFienPrint) May 13, 2015

Everyone's seeing phantom Kalindas, but no one is seeing phantom Robyns. WHERE'S ROBYN? #RobynTruther #TheGoodWife

— Elizabeth W. (@emwendorf) May 13, 2015

I don't recognize or acknowledge the Jem and the Holograms in the trailer I just watched.

— stacia l. brown (@slb79) May 12, 2015

tweets.author_name: Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars
tweets.html:
Frank Miller’s Jem and the Holograms. “Picture it: They’re all prostitutes!”

— Eric Goldman Likes the Star Wars (@TheEricGoldman) May 12, 2015

I don't understand how you can have Jem without the Misfits. Their songs were better. They were gonna get her.

— your favorite alex (me) (@alex_abads) May 13, 2015

I didn’t think it would be possible for me to type “disappointed in that Jem & The Holograms trailer” with a straight face, but here we are.

— Bah, Handlen! (@zhandlen) May 13, 2015

I really hope that horrible trailer for JEM & THE HOLOGRAMS gets everyone to finally appreciate the greatness of JOSIE & THE PUSSYCATS.

— Patrick Bromley (@patrickbromley) May 13, 2015

Jem and the Holograms trailer in a nutshell. pic.twitter.com/aMMVl05of4

— Hannah RM (@veronicafeverx) May 13, 2015

I mean you know that Jem was like a hero who tried to protect her company from corporate espionage, right?

— Linda H (@bookdal) May 13, 2015

That Jem and the Holograms movie is not what's up. I don't know what that is but it's not my damn childhood.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 13, 2015

Listen: Battleship had no narrative so someone built a narrative around it for better or worse. But Jem? JEM HAD A GODDAMN SHOW! WTFOMGBBQ.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 13, 2015

I mean, what is ACTUALLY the dramatic conflict? That Jem with the pink paint on her face goes solo? What. the. entire. EFF.

— Irascibly Ornery Dr. KW (@kristenwarner) May 13, 2015

My bet re. Jem and the Holograms - they had a "small town girl makes it big" script laying around, bought Jem, and did one round of rewrites

— Dan Olson 📼 (@FoldableHuman) May 13, 2015

I still can't get over the atrocity of the @jemthemovie trailer. Were they not allowed to research characters prior to making the film? #WTF

— Christine (@bsugirl) May 13, 2015

The JEM trailer is no no no no nope

— Jessica Luther (@scATX) May 13, 2015

If your source material is "holographic computer turns girl to rock god" and you think "what if... YOUTUBE STAR!?" you're an asshole.

— Seanbaby (@Seanbabydotcom) May 13, 2015

I watched the Jem trailer. No star earrings? Where are the misfits? 😢

— William Shatner (@WilliamShatner) May 13, 2015

That #JemAndTheHolograms trailer looks like it was made by people who saw the cartoon for a total of 5 minutes, with the sound off.

— Tom & Lorenzo (@tomandlorenzo) May 13, 2015

These original #AmericanIdol songs sound like sea chanties.

— Caissie St.Onge (@Caissie) May 13, 2015

This Amy Schumer sketch hath destroyed Late Night TV. #mylabradoodleevabraun

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) May 13, 2015

Now the Amy Schumer panel apology sketch (skit) is KILLING ME SOFTLY. I've definitely done this.

— Emily Nussbaum (@emilynussbaum) May 13, 2015

Missed Bill Hader doing sketch comedy so much. #InsideAmySchumer

— Dennis Perkins (@DennisPerkins5) May 13, 2015

What about black on black crime, Iris? #DatFlash #TheFlash

— Return of the Mack (@ArrogantDemon) May 13, 2015

Caitlyn you have GOT to start wearing flats. You work in a villain prison. Running is essential. #TheFlash #FanvFan

— Diana McCallum (@WordsOfDiana) May 13, 2015

"They won't be able to escape." Yeah, Barry, you should've been watching #Arrow a few months back. #TheFlash

— deborah (is mostly just tired) (@wordybee) May 13, 2015

"Wee're different from criminals. We only break the rules to help people." Spoken like he's been hanging w/ Jack Bauer. #TheFlash #DatFlash

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) May 13, 2015

Captain Cold alert! Please hide all scenery that should remain unchewed. #TheFlash

— Holly Jolly Christmas (@hollye83) May 13, 2015

Someone give Wentworth Miller a knife & fork because Captain Cold is here to (delightfully) chew all the scenery. #TheFlash #DatFlash

— hellresidentNY (@hellresidentNY) May 13, 2015

I need Wentworth Miller to read me a bedtime story. #TheFlash #DatFlash

— We So Nerdy (@WeSoNerdy) May 13, 2015

Barry is learning what happens when you give a fuck when it isn't your turn to give a fuck. #TheFlash

— Melanie Dione (@beauty_jackson) May 13, 2015

People on these shows need to stop trusting villains. They're villains. They are going to do evil things. #TheFlash

— Laura (@lschin12) May 13, 2015

Next week on #TheFlash: Cisco gives himself a villain name and a disguise, then calls Golden Glider using a fake voice.

— Randy Golden (@RandallGolden) May 13, 2015

This. Show. Fucking. Gets. It. #TheFlash #FanvFan

— Ian MacIntyre (@MrIanMacIntyre) May 13, 2015

Can't help but think Ray is going to feel a little stung when he learns he's not on the superhero phone tree. #TheFlash

— Andy (@AndyDaglas) May 13, 2015

OMG, they all know who you are, Oliver. No need to use the #Arrow voice. #TheFlash

— Kandis (@queenkandis) May 13, 2015

We love Joe on #TheFlash (#obv). But my son, whenever Joe brings a gun to a metahuman/superhero fight: "Joe. You're a Muggle. Sit down."

#iZombie is my official new favorite zombie anything since Zombieland. Sorry, The Walking Paint Drying.
